author: Tara Suter
description: Dozens of congressional Democrats in a series of letters on Wednesday urged states across the country to “block" Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s (ICE) access to driver data. “We write to alert you to the fact that your state is providing Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and other federal agencies with frictionless, self-service access to the...
title: Democrats urge states 'to block ICE's access' to driver data

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Jim McGovern (D-Mass.) slammed his Republican colleagues on Tuesday by referring to one of their outspoken allies as a testament to how much the GOP "messed up" their control of Congress. “Republicans have been in charge for 292 days. That’s 292 days to do something, anything, to lower costs, to bring down prices, to...
title: House Democrat to Republicans: Even Marjorie Taylor Greene 'thinks you've gone too far'

author: Emily Brooks
description: A discharge petition for a bill to release files related to Jeffrey Epstein got enough signatures on Wednesday to force action on the matter, setting the stage for a future clash on the House floor over the late sex offender. Rep. Adelita Grijalva (D-Ariz.) became the 218th and final signature on the discharge petition shortly...
title: Discharge petition to force House vote on Epstein files succeeds with Grijalva’s signature

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) on Wednesday called out Senate Democrats as a whole after eight lawmakers sided with Republicans on a deal to reopen the government. Ocasio-Cortez told reporters that blame for the situation extends beyond Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.), who met a heap of criticism from other Democrats over the deal's passage....
title: Ocasio-Cortez on shutdown deal: 'This problem is much bigger than Leader Schumer'

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Jesús “Chuy” García's (D-Ill.) chief of staff has launched her campaign to replace her outgoing boss, who is retiring after his current term. Patty García, who is unrelated to the congressman, touted her progressive positions and experience as a staffer on Capitol Hill in a release Wednesday announcing her bid to represent Illinois's 4th...
title: Retiring Rep. Jesús 'Chuy' García's chief of staff launches bid for House seat

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) swore in Rep. Adelita Grijalva (D-Ariz.) on Wednesday, more than a month after she was elected to fill the House seat. The ceremony, which occurred around 4 p.m. EST on the House floor, took place right before the lower chamber was slated to vote on a funding measure to end the...
title: Adelita Grijalva sworn in as a member of Congress ahead of shutdown vote

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The federal jobs and inflation reports for October may never get calculated and released after a record-length government shutdown froze economic data collection, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Wednesday. In a briefing with reporters, Leavitt said the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), which was mothballed for most of the shutdown, may not be...
title: White House: October jobs, inflation reports may never get published

description: Did you miss the northern lights on Tuesday night? Try using your phone to get a better look tonight.
title: Miss the northern lights? Try this phone camera trick to see the aurora tonight

description: A pair of top-ranking Democratic House members is not satisfied with answers received from Paramount's lawyers about the company's recent merger with Skydance. Energy and Commerce Committee ranking member Frank Pallone Jr. (D-N.J.) and Judiciary Committee ranking member Jamie Raskin (D-Md.) in a new letter on Wednesday admonished Paramount leadership for providing "inadequate and incomplete" responses to a previous...

description: Fox News anchor Martha MacCallum on Wednesday said Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) wants to "Mamdanify" the U.S. by helping more candidates like New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) run for office across the country. "The Democratic Socialists of America are growing," MacCallum said during an appearnace on "America's Nation." "It’s an increasing group. And...

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Democratic leaders on Wednesday introduced a discharge petition designed to force consideration of legislation to extend expiring ObamaCare subsidies for another three years. Behind House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.), the Democrats are hoping to entice a handful of moderate Republicans to endorse the petition, which will require 218 signatures to force a floor vote on...

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Hundreds of thousands of federal workers have been furloughed or working without pay since the government shut down on Oct. 1. Now, as Congress races toward a resolution to the record-breaking standoff, federal employees are poised to return to work — and should expect to see their back pay hit their bank accounts within days...

In an episode that aired after Carr suggested that Jimmy Kimmel be taken off the air over comments the late-night TV host made about...

description: Google sued a group of cybercriminals on Wednesday who they allege are responsible for illegal phishing scams that use company branding to target account holders.  The lawsuit filed with the Southern District of New York says that over 200 scammers have used Lighthouse software to impersonate reputable entities including E-ZPass and the U.S. Postal Service,...

description: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefit payments for millions of Americans that are on hold could soon resume in full as the government shutdown nears an end.  Action from Congress or the Supreme Court over the next two days will dictate whether the lapse will prolong or if the Trump administration must dole out full payments to...

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: MSNBC host Jen Psaki on Tuesday questioned "what happened" to Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) after a handful of Senate Democrats bucked the party and voted to reopen the government. Eight Democrats voted with Republicans in the upper chamber on Monday to advance a stopgap bill that would fund much of the government until...

description: A new poll shows Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-N.Y.), who is running for governor in New York, trailing Gov. Kathy Hochul (D) by only three percentage points, an early sign that the race could be extremely close if Stefanik wins the GOP primary. The survey of 500 likely New York voters by J.L. Partners, an independent...

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Democratic candidate Jordan Wood announced on Wednesday that he’s dropping his Maine Senate bid and instead running for retiring Rep. Jared Golden’s (D-Maine) seat in the House.  “Last week, Jared Golden announced that he’s not running for reelection, leaving open one of the most competitive House races in the entire country,” Wood said in a...

author: Max Rego
description: Even if the government shutdown ends this week, air travel will not instantly revert back to normal.  The 43-day funding lapse has thrown the country’s airspace into disarray, as air traffic controllers have missed two straight paychecks and are increasingly absent from work, with some taking second jobs. The resulting controller shortages led the Federal...
title: How the shutdown ending will impact air travel

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent teased Wednesday that the Trump administration would make announcements in the coming days to help reduce the costs of items such as coffee and bananas. "You're going to see some substantial announcements over the next couple days for things we don't grow here in the U.S.," Bessent said on "Fox &...
title: Bessent teases announcements to cut cost of coffee, fruits

description: There were some fireworks at Tuesday night’s House Rules Committee meeting ahead of the lower chamber's Wednesday vote to reopen the federal government. When Rep. Virginia Foxx (R-N.C.), the committee chair, recognized Democratic Rep. Yassamin Ansari (Ariz.), the latter welcomed her “back from your eight weeks of taxpayer-funded vacation.” After Ansari’s initial remarks, Foxx quickly...

description: Podcaster Joe Rogan worried out loud about the possibility of the U.S. inching further toward violent civil conflict during an episode of his talk show this week. "The ultimate expression of that is obviously Charlie Kirk," Rogan said, referencing the public assassination of the conservative activist during a Turning Point event in Utah last September. "Charlie...

description: Emails released by Democrats show convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein telling associates in the 2010s that “of course” President Trump knew about his relationships with underage girls. The three emails, released Wednesday by Democrats on the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, show Epstein’s correspondence with his associate Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as columnist and author Michael Wolff. description: Venezuela said late Tuesday that it is launching a “massive deployment” of nearly 200,000 soldiers in response to the U.S. sending its largest aircraft carrier into the waters near Latin America and rising tensions between the two countries. Venezuelan Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino López said officials were placing “the entire country’s military arsenal on full...
title: Venezuela military launching 'massive mobilization' amid tensions with US

author: Christine Black Szarzynski, opinion contributor
description: A whole level of society all over the world thrives untouched by consequences of their amoral decisions and behaviors. They are the untouchables, living above the people they harm.
title: Release the Epstein files — expose the untouchables and their elite enablers

description: President Trump joked in a new interview that building ballrooms is his “greatest strength” as he led a tour of the ongoing renovations in the East Wing of the White House. description: President Trump said late Tuesday that he will likely sue the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) over a clip of his Jan. 6, 2021, speech, that was used in a documentary that aired last year. “Well, I guess I have to,” Trump told Fox News’ Laura Ingraham on Tuesday. “Why not? description: Rep. Derrick Van Orden (R-Wis.) is riding halfway across the country on his motorcycle to avoid flight delays caused by the ongoing government shutdown. The Wisconsin Republican is among several members of Congress going to extraordinary measures to make it back to Washington, D.C. in time to vote on a spending package to end the...

description: Voters across party lines want Democrats to stand tall. Democratic leaders need to learn how to take that deafening “yes” for an answer.

description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) will swear in Rep.-elect Adelita Grijalva (D-Ariz.) on Wednesday afternoon, setting the stage for a fight over a push to release more files related to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Johnson will swear her in on the House floor at around 4 p.m. EST, his office said in a media...

description: President Trump in a new interview defended bringing in foreign workers on visas, arguing the U.S. did not have enough people with "certain talents" to do particular jobs. description: The House on Wednesday is returning to Washington after nearly two months out of session for a vote that could reopen the federal government and end the record-long shutdown. Most Democrats are firmly against the funding package, while Republicans are largely supportive. The bill appears poised to cross the finish line. Here are the key...

description: What the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) attempted to do with a sledgehammer, Congress succeeded in doing with gridlock and an unwillingness to compromise.

description: Venezuelan migrants in Panama are cautiously hopeful that the US military buildup in the Caribbean will finally bring an end to the long-standing authoritarian regime in Venezuela.

description: Democrats have racked up a number of key victories in the redistricting battle in recent days, giving the party hope it can cancel out GOP gains in next year’s midterms.  The party’s latest win came late Monday, when a judge rejected a Republican-drawn congressional map in Utah, giving Democrats a clear pickup opportunity in a...

author: Tara Suter
description: Former Rep. Elaine Luria (D-Va.), who spent time in the House between 2019 and 2023, is launching a comeback bid, according to a Wednesday statement. “I have served our country and the Commonwealth of Virginia since I was 17 years old, spending 20 years in the Navy as a nuclear engineer and four years as...
title: Former Rep. Elaine Luria to launch comeback bid in Virginia

author: Emily Brooks
description: The House returns Wednesday to vote on a spending package to end the longest government shutdown in U.S. history — an outcome widely viewed as a Republican victory over Democrats, who are now battling internally over how their firm stand on health care dissolved without a resolution.  Progressives are furious that a group of Senate...
title: House set to end historic shutdown as Republicans claim victory

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: The Senate bill to reopen the government is expected to pass the House on Wednesday, but there are a few key lawmakers in both parties who will make or break the vote as Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) navigates a razor-thin Republican majority in the lower chamber.  Nearly all House Democrats oppose the measure, which passed...
title: Key lawmakers to watch as House votes to end record shutdown

author: Amie Parnes
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom is seizing on a shutdown deal that has angered Democrats to bolster his standing as his party’s front-runner for the White House in 2028.  Democrats have largely greeted the coming end to the shutdown with anger, and Newsom has once again stepped into the void while his party has craved a...
title: Newsom leans into shutdown fight as he cements 2028 front-runner status

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer’s (N.Y.) handling of the deal between centrist Democrats and Republicans that is ending the 42-day government shutdown has left some Democratic colleagues fuming over what they are privately calling weak leadership. Some Senate Democrats wanted Schumer to step in forcefully to derail the efforts by Sens. Jeanne Shaheen (D-N.H.), Maggie...
title: Schumer’s shutdown moves leave some Democratic senators fuming

author: Niall Stanage
description: The smoke is beginning to clear as the six-week government shutdown nears its end, but the full political ramifications of the dispute remain up for debate. To be sure, if the shutdown is seen simply as a political battle of wills, Democrats lost. The minority party failed to come close to accomplishing its policy objectives,...
title: The Memo: Why this shutdown’s winners and losers are complicated
